title: Add scons support, .zip support, and Cantera package
body:
While the original goal of this PR was just to add a package for Cantera, I ended up having to do a little extra work:
- [x] Add support for SCons as a build system #986
- [x] Overhaul `spack create` mechanics #945, #1016
- [x] Add packages for Cantera, SuperLU_MT, 3to2, unittest2, unittest2py3k
- [x] Rewrite Sundials package from scratch
- [ ] Work out bugs in Sundials package

Now that SCons has been integrated into Spack, it supports parallel builds and doesn't require you to locate it with `which('scons')`. I modified the Serf package to use this. @robertdfrench Can you confirm that Serf and Subversion still build for you? The only thing that might go wrong is that Serf might not support being built in parallel.

When downloading a package that uses SCons, `spack create` will now detect this and provide the appropriate default installation instructions. While I was at it, I reorganized the code in a way I felt makes more sense. I also incorporated my changes from #945 since I didn't feel like merging them later. Let me know if you do/don't like it. It should probably be tested a little more...

Previously, when running `spack create` with a URL that points to a .zip file, Spack would try to peek into it with tar, and it would crash. Now, it uses unzip and correctly detects the files inside.

The Sundials package needed a complete overhaul. The URL changed, the previous version is no longer available, and "Starting with version 2.6.0 of sundials, CMake is the only supported method of installation." There are still a couple of bugs to work out. So far I am unable to get it to link to SuperLU_MT or SuiteSparse's KLU libraries. @tgamblin Do you happen to know any Sundials developers at LLNL?

There are also a few `depends_on` mechanics that don't work as expected for Cantera and Sundials.

I don't think any of these changes require updates to the documentation, but let me know if you think otherwise.
